article_title: Out-of-Control Fire in Norway Destroys Homes
article_text:
OSLO—Police in mid-Norway said 139 houses were affected by an out-of-control fire in the Flatanger coastal area, the second major blaze in as many weeks to hit the Scandinavian nation amid unseasonably dry winter conditions.

The incident, which started as a wildfire Monday night, comes after 40 houses were destroyed in the western Lærdal village on Jan. 18 and Jan. 19. The Lærdal fire left dozens homeless and has been classified as...
